Posts.Content: Apr 14, 2011 05:51PM wavesworld wrote: you can also get aarp and aaa life insurance even with stage 4.  i did.  you have to stay alive for 2 years from the time you begin.  each pays out 15,000, and it costs about 100 per month for the both of them.

Posts.Title: Tamoxifen and tumor shrinkage pattih Reneepals

Posts.Content: wavesworld wrote: hi, i'm in the middle of my 5th round of xeloda (one week on, one week off), for bone mets and one small liver met.  the liver involvement was diagnosed right after my 5th year anniversary with bone mets.  my cea was rising for the first time ever, and i knew something was up.  since taking xeloda, my cea is getting lower (from 7.9 - 4.3), but my alkaline phosphatase is rising (now 155) up 13 points in 3 weeks...my question is, have any of you had xeloda work on liver, while bone mets keep growing? also, how high has your alk.phos gone, and how did that correlate to your bone/liver involvement...thanks for any shared experiences with this... Dx 11/2004, ILC, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 0/13 nodes, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: elevated alkaline phosphatase wavesworld starstuff
